tagline: Wine and cheese in historic alleys.
description: We stroll through the cobblestone streets of Old Town Basel, the scent of aged cheese wafting from a nearby fromagerie. Our sommelier guide, with over 15 years of experience, leads us to hidden gems, where Swiss, Alsatian, and German varietals await. On the Rheinweg, we pause at a charming wine bar, its wooden façade worn smooth by time. Inside, the 2017 Pinot Noir from a family vineyard in Riehen is poured, its crisp notes complemented by an artisanal cheese from a local affinier. As we walk, the sommelier recounts tales of Basel's history, pointing out landmarks like the Münster, its red sandstone glowing in the fading light. We continue our journey, tasting and learning, the sounds of the old town - the clang of tram bells, the murmur of the Rhine - accompanying us.
highlights: Taste a 2017 Pinot Noir from a family vineyard in Riehen
Sample artisanal cheese from a local affinier on the Markthalle square
Explore the narrow streets of Old Town Basel with an expert guide
Visit a historic wine cellar beneath the streets of Basel
Learn about the history of Basel's wine trade along the Rhine
Enjoy a wine and cheese pairing in an intimate setting
